intro: Lagenocarpus martii f. longinux, commonly known as the longifoliate lagenocarpus, is a rare and unique variant of the species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is typically found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its distinct morphology and limited distribution, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires careful preservation efforts.
